message.content:
<<<api>>>: ImageIO.write
<<<code>>>: 
// Convert image to grayscale
BufferedImage image = ImageIO.read(new File(filename + getDateTime()+ ".jpg"));
BufferedImage grayImage = new BufferedImage(image.getWidth(), image.getHeight(), BufferedImage.TYPE_BYTE_GRAY);
Graphics g = grayImage.getGraphics();
g.drawImage(image, 0, 0, null);
g.dispose();

// Write the grayscale image back to the file
ImageIO.write(grayImage, "jpg", new File(filename + getDateTime()+ ".jpg"));
<<<explanation>>>: To reduce the file size of the screenshots, you can convert the images to grayscale before saving them. This can be done by creating a new BufferedImage of type TYPE_BYTE_GRAY and drawing the original image onto it. Then, you can write the grayscale image back to the file using ImageIO.write. This will result in a significant reduction in file size, but the images will only be in black and white.
